title: Class and Object: Basic OOP
description: Create a class Car with properties brand and speed. Add a method drive() that returns "Driving at {speed}".
solution:
<?php
class Car {
  public $brand;
  public $speed;
  function __construct($brand,$speed){
    $this->brand=$brand;
    $this->speed=$speed;
  }
  function drive(){ return "Driving at {$this->speed}"; }
}
$car=new Car('BMW',120);
echo $car->drive();
?>

title: Inheritance Example
description: Create classes Animal and Dog such that Dog extends Animal and overrides a sound() method.
solution:
<?php
class Animal {
  function sound(){ return 'Some sound'; }
}
class Dog extends Animal {
  function sound(){ return 'Bark'; }
}
$dog=new Dog(); echo $dog->sound();
?>

title: Handle Exceptions (try/catch)
description: Throw an exception if number < 0, otherwise print it.
solution:
<?php
function test($n){
  if($n<0) throw new Exception('Negative');
  return $n;
}
try{ echo test(-5); }
catch(Exception $e){ echo $e->getMessage(); }
?>
